Senior Mental Health Clinician

Company Name Forensicare Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 6 hours ago Number of views 3 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Part-time, Fixed-Term 12 months
  • 15 minutes from Melbourne’s CBD

\xa0

Forensicare is the statutory agency responsible for the provision of adult forensic mental health services across Victoria.


This position is located at the Community Forensic Mental Health Service (CFMHS) in Clifton Hill, 15 minutes from Melbourne’s CBD. CFMHS is a specialist state-wide agency that works with individuals who have a serious mental health illness and have offended, or are at risk of offending.

\xa0

About the role:

The Community Treatment and Transition Program provides mental health treatment and supervision of forensic patients transitioning from Thomas Embling Hospital to ensure they are adequately supported through their reintegration back into the community. The program assists Forensic Patients (patients as defined under the Crimes (Mental Impairment and Unfitness to be Tried) Act 1997) to meet the conditions of their Extended Leave until they progress onto a non-custodial supervision order. The program also provides post discharge supports for client’s subjects to Treatment Orders (under the Mental Health Act 2014) to support successful discharge and linkage to Area Mental Health services and other community based supports.

\xa0

Duties:

  • Case management
  • Ongoing mental state and risk assessment
  • Consultation and liaison with internal and external stakeholders to support discharge planning
  • Provision of reports and evidence to court

\xa0

Qualification, skills and experience:

  • Approved degree in Social Work, Occupational Therapy, Psychiatric Nursing or Psychologist, is registered with AHPRA or have other qualifications approved for membership of the Australian Association of Social Workers.
  • Minimum 5 years post qualifying experience within mental health preferably recent experience in community mental health setting.
  • Demonstrated experience and competency in conducting mental health and risk assessments and in planning, implementing, co-ordinating and evaluating complex case management interventions within recovery framework.
  • Demonstrated ability to provide leadership within multidisciplinary team
  • Knowledge of relevant legislation


For OTs and Psychologists only:


Please note:


All Occupational Therapy and Psychology applicants are required to submit their profile for this position on our eCredentaling system. If you are a new user of Mercury eCredentaling and do not have a current profile, you will be required to register. If you are an existing user of Mercury eCredentaling, please log in using your existing username and password.


Click on link below (or copy and paste in your browser) to submit your profile:


https://myclinicalprofile.com.au/OpenPositionLogin.aspx?UniqueId=07b0407a-4f12-4156-99af-83eba05cdad3\xa0

\xa0

Benefits:

We value our staff and provide a range of employee benefits including:

  • Great salary packaging conditions
  • Excellent leave entitlements
  • Ongoing training and full orientation
  • Comprehensive Health and Wellbeing Programs including: Staff health service, Critical Incident Stress Management and Employee Assistance Programs.

\xa0

Forensicare values a diverse workforce and strongly encourages applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people and people from culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds.


This position is subject to a Police Check.


Forensicare promotes the following values: responsiveness, integrity, impartiality, accountability, respect and leadership; and promotes behaviours that are consistent with these values at all times. Forensicare is an equal opportunity employer and offers a smoke free environment.

LECTURER/SENIOR LECTURER

Company Name University of Melbourne Company Location Parkville , Melbourne, VIC 3010, AU

New Posted Date Posted 9 hours ago Number of views 26 views

Job description

Job no: 0046857

Work type: Continuing

Location: Parkville

Division/Faculty: Melbourne Graduate School of Education

Salary: $120,993 - $139,510 (Level C)

Role & Superannuation rate: Academic - 17% superannuation

Salary:\xa0

Level B $98,775 - $117,290 p.a. plus 17% superannuation

Level C $120,993 - $139,510 p.a. plus 17% superannuation

Level of appointment is subject to qualifications and experience

\xa0

- Join Australia's number 1 University †

- Career opportunities, professional development, work-life balance.

- Use your expertise and innovative thinking to have an impact.


Who says you can't change the world? We expect to do nothing less.


The Melbourne Graduate School of Education (MGSE) is at the forefront of innovation in education, working with partners in schools, early childhood settings, communities, government and beyond, constantly seeking new and improved ways to support Australia's education system.


The MGSE is seeking a talented academic for a Lecturer or Senior Lecturer – Course Coordinator, Master of Teaching (Secondary) position, to lead the Master of Teaching (Secondary) course (MTeach), including the design, development, implementation, evaluation and reporting of the course.


As the successful candidate you will ensure the course is aligned with MGSE’s strategic directions and policies and complies with national accreditation requirements. The Course Coordinator will lead a diverse team working with stakeholders across the University, the Graduate School, and with partner organisations and authorities in the education community in the development of pre-service teachers.


The Course Coordinator will promote high quality and sustainable learning and teaching practices, including the use of innovative learning technologies and pedagogies and participate in research and other scholarly activities concerning the evaluation of the effectiveness and continuous improvement of the course. The Course Coordinator will play a key role in demonstrating the impact of the MTeach program through leading the Secondary stream’s contribution to the monitoring, research and evaluation plan and building on a well-established a culture of research-informed practice.


In addition, you will:

  • Demonstrate a deep understanding of the theoretical framework of evidence-based, interventionist clinical models of pedagogy and individualised learning informing the MTeach program;
  • Lead a multidisciplinary team and collaborate with colleagues to ensure cohesion the five MTeach streams; and
  • Design and deliver high quality teaching and learning in your field of expertise and undertake associated research. \xa0


Benefits

  • Maximise your benefits through our Salary Packaging scheme;
  • Flexible family friendly policies, providing generous leave and working conditions;
  • The opportunity to work in a culturally rich environment; and
  • A substantial discount to eligible staff and their immediate families in undertaking further studies at the University of Melbourne.


To find out more, go to http://about.unimelb.edu.au/careers/working/benefits


Culture

The University is a vibrant campus. We have well established clubs and networks giving the opportunity to engage and collaborate with other staff around the University. We strive to create an environment where staff and students promote culturally inclusive behaviour and activities, ensure cultural differences are heard and explored, and actively seek to learn from other cultures.


The University of Melbourne is the Number 1 University in Australia and among the leading Universities in the world, according to The Times Higher Education world reputational ranking, the National Taiwan University ranking, The Times Higher Education world university ranking and Shanghai Jiao Tong Academic Ranking of World Universities.


Advertised: 11 Oct 2018 12:00 AM AUS Eastern Daylight Time
Applications close: 31 Oct 2018 11:55 PM AUS Eastern Daylight Time


For full position information and to apply online go to :
http://jobs.unimelb.edu.au/caw/en/job/897880/lecturersenior-lecturer

Health & Safety Inspector - Multidisciplinary

Company Name WorkSafe Victoria Company Location Multiple Locations Available

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 112 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

At WorkSafe, we’re passionate about our vision for a safer Victoria. Our people come from a diverse range of backgrounds, and the breadth of their perspectives means we can have meaningful impact on individual lives.

We offer a range of great benefits, including work variety, workplace flexibility and leave options, learning and development opportunities, study support, a leading health and wellbeing program, contribution to gym memberships and discounted corporate health insurance rates. WorkSafe prides itself on being a great place to work.

WorkSafe Health and Safety Inspectors care about ensuring Victorian workplaces are safe and that all workers return home to their loved ones at the end of the day. We’re looking for people who share this passion and have practical knowledge and experience of occupational health and safety.

As a Health & Safety Inspector you will:
  • Be a safety leader – the face of WorkSafe
  • Provide information, advice, education and guidance to companies to minimise the potential for injuries and illness
  • Use your experience working in the industry and your understanding of safety management to ensure compliance with the full range of OHS legislation to achieve improvements at these workplaces
  • Build positive relationships with Victorian industry and the wider community

Skills & experience:
  • Experience working in agriculture, health, manufacturing, logistics or generalist building or construction industry advantageous
  • Excellent communication skills and the ability to educate others, resolve conflict and negotiate
  • Information-gathering and investigative skills to identify key issues, resolve problems and deal with complex health and safety issues
  • Sound understanding of current Victorian OHS legislation
  • Adaptability to change and a resilience in adverse situations
  • Ability to use technology to carry out your role in the field
  • A current Victorian driver's licence
  • A Tertiary qualification in Occupational Health and Safety advantageous, but not mandatory

Only people with the right to work in Australia may apply for this position. You will be required to undergo a National Police Check and Medical Assessment as part of the recruitment process.

If you are successful in progressing through this recruitment process, you will be required to be available the following times:
  • 12 – 15 November for Assessment Centres
  • 26 – 30 November for Interviews
  • Late January 2019 for Commencement

For more information on becoming an inspector and the application process please visit the careers section of our website: www.worksafe.vic.gov.au/careers

If you require further information please contact Slade on (03) 9253 5103 or email worksafe@sladegroup.com.au

Click the link to apply, and join us in making a difference to Victorian lives

Applications close midnight on Tuesday 23rd October 2018. Get your applications in early!

WorkSafe are striving to build a diverse workforce that reflects the Victorian community we serve.

Senior Business Analyst - Data & Connected Retail

Company Name MECCA Brands Company Location 34 Wangaratta St, Richmond, VIC 3121, AU

New Posted Date Posted 2 hours ago Number of views 14 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

We did it! We ranked #5 in the 2018 Best Places to Work study for Australia!


THE ROLE YOU COULD PLAY

Datadatadataatadatadata…. MECCA Tech is looking for a strong Business Analyst with a passion for data and retail. In striving to be the #1 Beauty Destination in ANZ, we are migrating to a new data platform along with some other innovative and really exciting digital initiatives. We need a Business Analyst to document business data requirements and translate these to hand over to the data engineering team, to enable them to build data integrations and data views for the business. You will also work across a number of fast paced digital initiatives liaising with the business and IT stakeholders to document requirements and ensure details are clearly understood and documented.


Your proactive approach and effective communication, will be key to aligning with the program team members, to ensure working towards achievable deadlines and a proactive approach to dealing with challenges or hurdles is desirable along with a self-directing mindset, using your experience to create solutions where required.


WE THINK YOU WOULD BE PERFECT IF…

At MECCA, we live and breathe our values every day, and we get excited about jumping out of bed to fulfil our purpose of enabling our customers to look and feel their best. Our culture is welcoming, supportive and energetic but we also have high expectations for all our MECCA-mazing team members. If you approach life with the attitude that nothing is a problem and there is a solution for everything, and you take pride in being exceptional at your job, then you will fit right in!


Our perfect candidate has:

  • Minimum of 7 years’ experience as a Business Analyst with exposure to a retail environment
  • Experience of data migration and platforming projects
  • Experience in delivering digital channel projects
  • Retail systems domain (preferred), however candidates that have deep industry / technical experience in other industries would be considered and expected to demonstrate an ability to quickly acquire new technical & domain knowledge
  • Good understanding of BI tools and ideally experience of the Tableau BI product.
  • Broad experience in a variety of delivery methodologies, including waterfall and agile that aligns to the SDLC methodology
  • Extensive experience in;
    • Technical Analysis and Design Techniques
    • Process mapping As-Is and To-Be business processes
    • Requirement gathering and solution gap analysis
  • Experience in building relationships with key stakeholders to understand business functions, processes and challenges.
  • Demonstrated ability to operate at different technical levels, tailoring communication style to stakeholders with differing levels of knowledge and understanding in both business and technical situations.
  • Broad understanding of testing tools and techniques (incl Test Automation, Performance, Load and Stress / Volume Testing).
  • Ability to take ownership to define and document project scope, requirements, and deliverables to support business goals in collaboration with senior management and stakeholders
  • Ability to assist project managers to develop full-scale project plans and associated communication documents


WHAT WE CAN OFFER YOU IF YOU JOIN US

We are in the business of delivering happiness to our team members, our customers and our broader community, and we love to acknowledge each team member’s contribution to our success. From quarterly product allowances, unlimited 40% discount and free products, through to reward and recognition programs, professional development programs, and health and well-being initiatives, we promise you that our unique company culture will constantly surprise and delight you - we will never be finished in making MECCA Brands the best place to work!


A LITTLE MORE ABOUT US

At MECCA Brands, we bring customers the best in global beauty across our 4 retail concepts: MECCA Cosmetica, MECCA Maxima, MECCA and mecca.com.au. We offer an exclusive edit of over 100 brands, paired with exceptional customer service and beauty expertise within each retail environment.


Working at MECCA Brands will never be just a job. Our unique and positive culture ensures team members are surrounded by other incredible and inspiring people, amazing opportunities, experiences and challenges, enabling them to be the best they can be in everything they choose to do.


To learn more about life at MECCA Brands and to apply for this position, please visit www.mecca.com.au/careers\xa0

IT Domain Architect - Infrastructure

Company Name Greythorn Australia, an Experis Company Company Location Melbourne, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 12 hours ago Number of views 6 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

IT Domain Architect - Infrastructure

  • Exceptional Customer/Stakeholder Relationship Experience Required!
  • Strong Background in Infrastructure Architecture
  • Develop - Grow - Learn


The purpose of the IT Domain Architect role is to provide architectural leadership, including planning and governance, to enable the effective planning, implementation and use of digital technology within a specified domain.

The IT Domain Architect works closely with the business at a senior level to facilitate Architecture options analysis and decisions to ensure solutions are designed to meet business needs, project and program requirements as aligned to the Digital Strategy. This role is key to engagement and communication between the Business and Domain Stakeholders to ensure solutions are deliver business value, are consistent with the enterprise architecture and architecture principles and support the Digital Strategy.


Key Relationships:

  • Business stakeholders
  • IT Leadership Team
  • Architects / Systems Managers / Infrastructure / IT Operations / IT Service and Program Delivery
  • Project resources


Skills, Knowledge AND Experience Required:

  • Strong infrastructure architecture experience including data centre strategy, networking, compute, storage and cloud (ideally Azureand/or AWS)

912858612:
[

Senior Ruby Developer

Company Name REA Group Company Location Richmond, Melbourne, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 9 hours ago Number of views 8 views

Be an early applicant

Job description


We're rebuilding our product and finance systems using Ruby and we'd love you to come help us.



About the role
The Money tribe is looking for a Senior Ruby Developer to join us and help build the systems and applications that will help drive REA forward on its mission to 'change the way the world experiences property'. We're using Ruby, Rails, microservices, Docker, and AWS to create a platform that the rest of the business can innovate on top of. You'll be deeply involved in the design and creation of the systems that let REA create new products, bundle them together, provision them to customers and collect money.



What you will learn

  • Ruby - most of our systems are written in Ruby which might sound weird for issuing invoices, but it's been working great so far!
  • AWS - all our developers create, support, and monitor infrastructure using Amazon Web Services. There's loads of internal support so don't be afraid if this is new.
  • Docker - all our apps are tested and deployed using Docker. Just like with AWS there's heaps of support for this and also internal training.
  • Domain Driven Design - we're half-way through smashing our legacy monolith and replacing it with Ruby microservices. You might read about microservices on Hackernews, but here is where you get hands on experience.
  • Agile - REA is renowned for its agile approach. Teams are given the autonomy to come up with solutions independently in cross-functional teams.




What we expect:

  • Approximately 5+ years' experience in software development.
  • Proven experience with Ruby and/or Ruby on Rails.
  • Experience developing and deploying software.
  • A desire to mentor and guide less experienced members of the team.
  • Experience with Test Driven Design.




What is it like to work with us?
Each team has around 10 people who collectively represent technology, business, and product and work together to maintain existing products while building new capabilities for the business. Each day we get together, talk about what we've just done, what we're about to do then work together during the day. We believe strongly in pairing, testing, continuous delivery. Each week we participate in guilds across the company to keep our skills sharp and increase our impact, and in team retrospectives where we keep track of how our team is going. Your manager acts as a mentor to help guide you and your career, instead of being someone who monitors your day to day.



We're committed to creating inclusive, safe environments where anyone, no matter their background, can contribute and succeed.



What you get beyond a great remuneration package

  • Birthday leave. A day off for your birthday.
  • Flexible working arrangements. We've got people who work 4 days a week, and people who work from home.
  • 3 days every 4 months in our regular hackathon - See: http://hackday.realestate.com.au
  • Industry leading parental leave system.
  • Onsite health and wellbeing programs, including yoga and meditation classes along with showers and clean towels for when you work up a sweat.




About REA Group
REA Group is one of the world's largest property and lifestyle media companies. Best known in Australia for realestate.com.au, the market-leading property site and app, we're also a fast-growing global business spanning three regions. People use our sites and apps when finding a place to rent or buy (a home, co-work space or commercial property), as well as for property data, news, financial services, inspiration, renovation ideas, and to better understand their neighbourhoods and the property market. From our humble beginnings in a Melbourne garage more than 20 years ago, to a global company helping reimagine digital property experiences; we have played a key role in shaping the entire digital sector in Australia, especially through the talented people we have nurtured, and continue to develop.

Mid-Senior level

Industry

  • Online Media

Employment Type

Full-time

Job Functions

  • Information Technology

About Us


Guild Group is the parent company of Guild Insurance, Acerta, Guild Superannuation Services and Meridian Lawyers. Our Finance, Technology, People & Culture and Risk, Audit and Compliance divisions partner with these businesses to deliver their strategy.

We’re a nimble and dynamic business with big aspirations in a build and grow phase, and we seek talented specialists to join us on our journey.


The Role

You will also support the CEO and Executive team to communicate their vision and business strategy, helping to bring this to life for all Guild Group employees (including the national and offshore office network). \xa0 As a member of the People & Culture team, you will be key in helping to support employee engagement through best-practice internal communications across a range of channels including: intranet, EDM publications, Town Halls and video. Job description

What we are looking for:


AAM are looking for a level 2 technical support analyst that will provide local and remote assistance to our global employees. You will be required to work out of a ticket based helpdesk system, and will provide a combination of face to face, phone, remote and email based support.


While you will be based in AAM’s Melbourne office, you will be part of the global IT support team providing service to local, national and international users.


To be successful in this position, you will need to be motivated, able to work autonomously, self-starting and able to take initiative and ownership of issues and problems.


What you will do:


  • Manage and resolve first, second and some third level IT support requests
  • Respond to phone calls and e-mails through the Helpdesk from clients and internal staff regarding technical support issues (remedial or add, move and change)
  • Troubleshoot issues related but not limited to software, hardware, servers, routers, firewalls, peripherals and networking equipment
  • Support and administration of Exchange / Office 356 environment
  • Server and PC/Laptop support and build, software installations and deployment
  • Support for unified communication systems, mobile telephone and varied communication systems across AAM
  • Participate in infrastructure upgrade projects as required
  • Some after-hour / on call work will be required

\xa0


What we need from you:


To be successful in this role you will already have at least 5 years prior experience in a similar role together with:


  • Strong customer service background, taking pride in your work and striving to achieve a high level of customer service
  • Have a wide variety of technical skills and abilities across desktop, server and network environments
  • Firewall, router and general network knowledge
  • Troubleshooting experience in a Microsoft environment (Windows 7/8/10, MS Office, print, hardware, AD/Exchange/O365, file servers, etc)
  • Able to work well as part of a team, but also possessing a strong ability to work autonomously
  • Excellent English communications skills, verbal and written, strong interpersonal skills are a must
  • Ability to multi-task, prioritise and problem solve
  • Organised, flexible and work within an environment where systems are undergoing continual change
  • Self-starting, motivated, able to take ownership through to completion
  • Are willing to learn and grow in the role with a solid work ethic and the desire to learn and develop

\xa0

In addition to having previous experience in a similar role, skills in the following areas are highly desired:


  • Microsoft server and networking technologies (AD, DNS, DHCP, GPO)
  • Virtualisation (VMWare, Hyper-V)
  • Understanding of cloud infrastructure and hosted hardware (AWS, Azure)
  • Exchange & Office 365 and SharePoint
  • DELL EMC hardware
  • Cisco, Meraki, HP networking experience
  • Knowledge of GIS, MicroStation and AutoCAD applications

\xa0

Minimum Qualifications and Experience:


  • Tertiary qualifications or equivalent in IT
  • 5 years plus in a similar role
  • Current Class C Driver’s licence
  • Current passport
  • Experience with 0365 and Skype for business

\xa0

How to apply


Apply via Seek by submitting your resume and a covering letter summarising your experience and outlining why you are interested in the role.

Confidentiality assured

Only successful short-listed candidates will be contacted.


Closing date 26 October

No Agencies please

913096118:
[

AFL Umpiring Community Umpiring Development Manager

Company Name Australian Football League (AFL) Company Location Melbourne, AU

New Posted Date Posted 26 minutes ago

Be an early applicant

Job description

About Us

As an organisation, the AFL works tirelessly in all states and at all levels to enhance and grow the game – from grassroots to elite. Together, we put on the game, deliver important events, communicate with our fans, run community programs, develop coaches and umpires, and collaborate with partners, delight members, support clubs and so much more. While our roles may vary we are all united by a common goal, to leave the game in an even more extraordinary place.

About The Role

The Community Umpiring Development Manager will collaboratively develop, implement and oversee a national Community Umpiring Development strategy in consultation with all State/Territory bodies that drives growth in umpire participation through increased recruitment and retention; high quality umpiring performance through education and development programs that promote inclusive, sustainable and quality environments.

Please note, employment in this position is subject to a satisfactory criminal history record check.

A DAY IN THE LIFE OF

Umpire Performance

Regularly Review, Modify And Improve
  • The national umpiring curriculum to ensure it meets the needs of community umpires.
  • The national accreditation system/program that applies to umpires and umpire coaches to ensure they are both engaging, meaningful and produce better qualified and prepared community umpires.

Umpire Recruitment
  • Develop and implement a marketing and promotional strategies/initiatives to increase community umpire recruitment.
  • Manage and co-ordinate the AFL Umpire Appearance Program, the AFL Community Umpiring Round and the “Umpire.AFL” social media platforms.
  • Understand the key challenges and issues that face community umpiring to identify and deliver solutions that result in meaningful improvement.

Umpire Retention
  • Plan and facilitate opportunities to share Community Umpiring Group best practice (blueprint) with interested external umpiring stakeholder groups and leagues.
  • Investigate the possibility of establishing an umpiring specific “community club improvement program” as per that for community football clubs.

Umpire Resources
  • Develop and disseminate national resources that support the recruitment and development of umpires at community level.
  • Develop and maintain a dynamic central technology portal where all community umpiring resources can be readily accessed.

Umpire Diversity
  • Develop and implement strategies/initiatives to increase the recruitment and retention of umpires from diverse backgrounds (Female, Multicultural and Indigenous).
  • Manage and co-ordinate the umpiring program at the AFL Diversity Championships or similar State/Territory based programs/events.

Stakeholder Management
  • Build and maintain strong relationships with State and Community Umpiring personnel.

OUR IDEAL TEAM MEMBER
  • Experience in sports management/development or similar
  • High level problem solving skills.
  • Ability to reach objective conclusions after appropriate consultation
  • Comprehensive understanding of AFL football
  • Strong communication skills with the ability to influence internal and external stakeholders
  • Excellent presentation skills including verbal and written communications
  • Sound knowledge of the Laws of Australian Football
  • Budget management experience and skills
  • Experience in stakeholder management and engagement
  • Ability to identify future challenges and develop plans to address them
  • Strong leadership skills
  • Collaboration, negotiation and influencing skills

OUR CULTURE

http://www.afl.com.au/careers/experience-extraordinary

THE PERKS
  • We believe in a Healthy Mind, Healthy Body and Healthy Workplace and our staff have access to an extensive Health and Wellbeing program
  • My Development – all employees have access to the AFL’s My development program which consists of on the job training, coaching and mentoring and formal learning.
  • AFL Staff Footy Memberships – easy access to the game, staff can share these with family and friends
  • My Benefits – staff have access to over 350 discounts with some of the biggest retailers and the AFL’s Corporate Partners

Applications close: 22 October 2018

Seniority Level

Mid-Senior level

Industry

  • Sports
  • Nonprofit Organization Management
  • Education Management

Full-time

  • Other

Sales Development Representative

New Posted Date Posted 6 hours ago Number of views 1 view

Job description

Looking to take the next step in your sales career? Want to move into software sales and be part of a high performing team? Welcome to Ento! We’re growing rapidly and our sales team is looking for another Sales Development Rep to join them. You’ll be exposed to all aspects of a deal cycle and have tonnes of opportunity to learn and grow.\xa0


As a Sales Development Rep you’ll be an integral part of our sales team, identifying and opening opportunities with prospective clients and working closely with our Account Executives. We’re looking for someone who has experience in b2b sales, who is keen to move into software sales and build a career!\xa0


About you
You’ll be a team player who loves a challenge and is focused on chasing down goals and targets.\xa0


A natural communicator, you’ll be adept at building rapport and be confident extracting and sharing information.\xa0


Passionate about tech, you are looking for an opportunity to help businesses understand how it can drive outcomes.

If so this sounds like you we’d love to hear from you!

About us
Ento is a Series-A funded, Melbourne based, SaaS startup leading the future of workforce management in a highly fragmented market littered with legacy vendors. Our team thrives on the challenge of balancing flexibility and power with speed and beauty.

We’ve been developing software since 2009 and have an established client base featuring many household names. Tens of thousands of Australians use our software every day and we are focused on continually improving the workplace experience for both employees and employers alike.

What you’ll do

  • Open discussions with prospective customers via a combination of email and cold-calling
  • Nurture leads by maintaining regular contact cycles
  • Qualify leads and book meetings for customers to meet with our Account Executives
  • Maintain accurate CRM records to ensure complete visibility of pipeline & opportunities
  • Own your prospects and achieve monthly quotas of qualified opportunities and closed business

Your background
  • Exposure to B2B sales\xa0
  • Tech savvy by nature (or have experience in SaaS / software)
  • Motivated by targets and deadlines, always striving to exceed expectations
  • An amazing relationship builder and investigative questioner
  • Always looking to do better, taking feedback & coaching objectively, not personally
  • Driven to succeed in whatever you do

What’s on offer
  • Awesome culture and a great team. We trust our people to deliver and you’ll be able to work autonomously knowing support is there if you need it.\xa0
  • Great tech, all the tools to do your job well and some that just make it easier - like stand-up desks and Salesforce CRM.\xa0
  • An amazing office aesthetic - we have light and airy offices with everything you could ask for - 3-phase coffee machine, ping-pong tables and a fully stocked kitchen.
  • Opportunities to learn - including 2.5 days per set aside to focus on your professional development plus budget to attend trade shows, conferences and courses.\xa0
  • We pull off the impossible and you’ll love working with us!
